Squat.shortDescription: Back squats are a lower body exercise where you hold a barbell on your upper back, then squat down until your thighs are parallel to the ground before standing back up. They primarily target the quadriceps, hamstrings, and glutes.

Bench Press.shortDescription: Bench press is a classic strength training exercise that involves lifting a weighted barbell while lying on a bench, and is known for targeting and building the muscles of the chest, shoulders, and triceps.

Deadlift.shortDescription: Deadlifts are a popular compound exercise that work the muscles of the back, glutes, and hamstrings by lifting a weighted barbell off the ground using a hip hinge movement pattern. They can be done with heavy weights to improve overall strength and power.

Bicep Curls.shortDescription: Bicep curls are a popular isolation exercise that involve lifting a weight with your palms facing upwards to target and strengthen the biceps muscles in the front of your upper arm. They can be performed with a variety of equipment and are often included in arm workouts.
